Reviews.Title: “Stayed here on a Business trip.”
Reviews.Author: Firefozz
Reviews.Content: This is the second time staying here the 1st in 1991 on our honeymoon. Both times I have found the hotel pleasant and accomadating. My recent stay I found the rooms very comfortable large and modern. The location is very close to the Quarters attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Read the fine print when making a reservation”
Reviews.Author: WinderGeorgiaTravels
Reviews.Content: Made my reservation last week for a possible trip to New Orleans in 8 months.....only to find this morning that they've already billed me in advance for my stay. I can understand doing this during Mardi Gras or Sugar Bowl, but not for an April weekend. After reviewing my reservation, in the section where it tells the cancellation pollcy....is one line that says they collect the deposit in advance. Needless to say, after reading the other reviews here, I've cancelled this one and will be looking elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Alicia L
Reviews.Content: We booked a room here for the first two nights of our honeymoon before our cruise left out of New Orleans and we were a little surprised at what we received for our money. First of all the room we booked was SMALL. It had one queen bed, an itty bitty bathroom, a desk, mini fridge and closet, all shoved into a really tight space. I felt like while we were in the room, there was no privacy for either of us, whether we wanted it or not. The view from the room was the top of a shorter side of the hotel which was quite honestly gross to look at. When we walked into the room it was hot, the air had not been running at all. The next morning when we woke up (at about 7am) there was absolutely no hot water. For us, it really wasn't a huge deal since we weren't planning on leaving to see the city yet, but it was a work day and there were business men staying in the hotel as well. They clearly did not get a hot shower that morning - I'm sure they didn't leave happy! We aren't sure if the hot water is a typical problem for them or not, but just beware! They had it fixed and HOT within 2-3 hours, but the whole ordeal was a pain. The included breakfast is nothing to get excited about...but at least it was something! Parking is in the lot across the street...I think it was $14/day (self-park in a lot just for Clarion guests). Felt safe leaving our car there. This hotel is a few blocks down from Bourbon St (a very short walk)...overall felt like it was a safe area and we had no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible accommodations, keep looking around”
Reviews.Author: DivaTee762012
Reviews.Content: Divas get away turned into a nightmare!!! We were under the impression that our two (2) Queen Suites would be adjoining. Once we arrived, we were very unhappy to find out they were not and we were not pleased to be initially placed two doors away from one another. Then imagine our surprise when we entered the rooms, (not at all what we pictured for a Suite) expecting more square footage and WE got less! All four rooms (kitchen, sitting area, bedroom and bathroom) were extremely tiny. Not spacious at all!! Very, very disappointing. During the course of our five (5) day stay, my girlfriends and I were relocated to different rooms four (4) times due to cleanliness, broken sofa beds and HUGE bugs in the room!! This caused a great deal of stress to us considering we had to keep repacking and then unpacking. We NEVER felt settled. Pass on this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure u ready to deal with the BS”
Reviews.Author: shoodygirl
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation in November 2011 for July visit..I booked with antonio the general manager so i wouldn't have any issues because I knew the hotel would be sold out for this particular weekend due to essence festival...anyway upon arrival I was told my reservation had been cancelled in December and I was sent an email..I was furious...I immediately called my cc company because i say the charge had been processed months ago on my statement...I sat on hold with cc company while I was on hold the girl behind the counter who was assistant manager of the property began to tell me how she was the one who initialed the acct once the charge declined and how i had no $ in my acct. Almost n hour on hold with cc company n being humiliated n front of other guest..the cc company found the date n the charge n kept telling dummy behind counter that the charge was valid...she had no other choice but to give me my room..got to room bathroom door had big holes n it n u can tell by looking at dirty baseboards that cleaning was not so big of a priority for them...only good thing is Fred breakfast chicken, heirs, sausages, real eggs and handsome security guard Jared at the door...lol

Reviews.Title: “I got exactly what I paid for in a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: My friends and I came down from North Central MS for a bachelorette party in the French Quarter. At first, getting to Canal St, we got a little leary regarding the neighborhood the hotel would be in. However, once we found the hotel and got out, all of those concerns were squashed. The staff is WONDERFUL, especially the guys who do the valet parking. That was the best 22 dollars I spent all night. Traffic was atrocious but there wasn't anything the hotel could have done about that. I didn't find not ONE person who was rude in the least. The room was clean and very adequate with the little kitchenette and a nice sized bathroom. We had a great view of the fun out on the strip. Soft sheets and plenty of pillows. I plan on staying here again in the future and more of these establishments elsewhere. We were within walking distance from Bourbon St and made it to and from just fine safely.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly pleased..”
Reviews.Author: Venbro
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, we were afraid, but were locked into reservations already. We we're pleasantly pleased. Valet parking was the only thing not advertised on the website. ($22/day) hotel looks like it has been remodeled. We stayed on the 3rd floor and the room was fine and bed very comfortable. Free hot breakfast buffet was a plus also.

Reviews.Title: “GGood location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Kildress
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 2 night stay here with my son. We had a very comfortable corner (Saratoga St. and alley) room that featured an unexpected kitchenette with fridge, microwave and sink. There were two comfortable queen beds and a small but adequate bathroom. The hotel is an older property and appears to have been updated. This work may not yet be complete as we noticed that one of the elevators was decorated in a New Orleans style whilst the other was simply dark wood requiring redecoration. Continental breakfast was included. It had a reasonable selection of food and my only criticism was that there were not enough tables at busy times. Bringing breakfast food to the rooms was (sensibly) prohibited so clients have to just wait around. There is a business center off the lobby that I did not use but which appeared to be suitably equipped. The fitness suite on floor 2 was reasonably well equipped. The hotel is right on Canal Street with a trolley stop outside. The reception staff provided change when asked and told us about buying a day pass ($3) rather than individual journey tickets ($1.25), very good advice. I read some of the other reviews and have to disagree with several points raised: I noticed no trash or odors anywhere and thought the property was in fairly good condition and well maintained. The staff did appear busy (maybe it is understaffed in these difficult times) but always courteous and helpful (making change, giving trolley advice and calling a cab etc.). There is a single step at the front door on Canal Street, it is highlighted with yellow paint and warning signage. It really should cause very little obstruction to a roller bag. However, for larger bags, strollers, wheelchairs etc., there is another door on Saratoga Street (directly opposite the parking lot and 30/40 yards from the front door). It features two ramps and there is clear signage at the front door identifying its existence and location, you'd have to be blind or asleep to miss it! All things considered this is a good hotel, close to all the action and with sensible pricing. I would certainly go back and could recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: PinkTy
Reviews.Content: I've been to New Orleans a million times, my hubby (1st time) and I've never been to a hotel that I was ready to leave before I got to my room. The girl that checked us in 6.22.12 that night, sat and talked to us. At first we didn't even know if someone was there. They were also very light staffed on valet. Got to the room and this was the SMALLEST room I've ever seen. Smaller than motels. It was however, VERY CLEAN (that's why we stayed). We had to go to the front desk again, and low and behold, I had to wait for the same girl to get off of a personal phone call to ask her a question. They need to coach this girl on customer service. The lady that checked us out in the morningn (6.24.12), however, was very professional. Even though the hotel was clean, I doubt if I ever stay at this hotel or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: NextStopIsWhere
Reviews.Content: I used to work for Choice Hotels and would stay here sometimes under my employee discount. It has been a while so I am sure things could change. I haven't stayed here since last summer. We were always upgraded to bigger rooms than what we originally booked and the view of the city was always awesome. I may post pictures. Staff was very kind. Rooms were always clean. Parking was only $12.00 (I believe) being that it was a weeknight. They always gave my friends and I late check-outs since they didn't have many arrivals. I liked how the hotel had LED lights that would frequently change colors throughout the night, very retro feel. Close walk to Bourbon Street, no one gave us any trouble on the way there. I was satisfied with my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Reservations a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Kirby03
Reviews.Content: Reservation was cancelled rebooked and was cancelled a second time, without notice. No information on website or confirmation email regarding full prepayment up front for room, over 1200.00 Independent owner non apologetic and unwilling to review policy. New customer to clarion chain will not be a customer again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent price, but dreary.”
Reviews.Author: Montana W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good price ($129.99) but had no view, literally, and was just dark and dreary. It was very cutely decorated and clean, just a little old. The staff could have been friendlier, but for the price we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosieox
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned when we read the reviews, but our room was excellent. We got a King Suite on the 15th floor, and the room was new, comfortable, very clean and very spacious. The only slight knock was the bathroom was a little small. Just thought with all that extra room for the suite, maybe making the bathroom a little larger would have been nice. Great view down Canal Street. We were walking distance to Bourbon Street. Bourbon St. and Canal is where the Garden District Trolley can be caught too. The Staff was very friendly and helpful. We got there before check in time, and the front desk asked us to wait in the lobby while they sent the cleaning crew to our room. We got into our room within 30 minutes. Every time we went in or out of the lobby the manager was there asking if everything was ok. Parking is across the side street, but itâ€™s gated and I believe guarded, and our car was just fine. Breakfast was ok, not great, basic free breakfast fare. Next time we come to New Orleans, weâ€™re staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Alabama5022
Reviews.Content: Six of us needing one room, 3 beds. Only hotel that offers this in New Orleans. Friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfrotable rooms, and nice comp continental breakfast. Not right in the heart of the French Quarter but the street car stops right in front of the hotel. For the money and our needs, this was prefect. Only downfall for us is that there was no pool. Otherwise, will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bill H
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel with quirks and character. During peak times (ex. Mardi Gras), it costs a fortune as do all hotels in NOLA. Most of the time, the rates are more reasonable. If you want a brand new hotel with no character, you will either be in a distant suburb or need to pay a small fortune. I stayed during a big conference (CTIA) and it was costly ($200 per night), but it was convenient and less costly than the big chains ($500+). It was clean, the staff were not stressed, and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “From the perspective of an employee.”
Reviews.Author: hiimatraveler
Reviews.Content: I work for this brand but in a different state, and I came down to New Orleans very scared from all the reviews that I had read about this property here on Trip Advisor. I can honestly say that everything people were saying I did not experience. We weren't in the hotel much but to just sleep and to gather our bearings, but it was great for what we needed it and it was within walking distance to the french quarter. One thing about this hotel is that you can tell that they do not cater to their guests needs/wants/desires. They're located in a part of the city where they will have business and be sold out, NO MATTER WHAT. They don't need you, and they have no problem making you feel as if that's the case. I spoke with the GM, he wasn't even the least bit interested that I was an employee, and did not seem interested in knowing how our stay was going. That though, is my biggest and only complaint. The room was spacious, the bed was great, the view wasn't the best but that's a moot point. If you want to be blocks from the french quarter, right at a street car stop and have a good room for a good price, then you should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: APetersPA
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for one night during the NCAA Final Four because our cruise was leaving the next day out of the Port of New Orleans. The hotel, while being on Canal Street, is further away from the "touristy" area (Bourbon Street, Harrah's Casino, etc), but my mom and I are walkers so it did not bother us. Check in was easy. I confirmed myu reservation with the hotel directly as this was Final Four weekend and there were absolutely NO rooms. We got our keys and waited for the elevator. And waited. And waited. Even though the hotel had two elevators, both were very slow. I want to chalk that up to the fact that the hotel was to capacity (?). We got to our flor and at first we weren't sure if we were in the same building as the hallway was very "hospital" looking. We got to our room, which had two double beds, a bathroom with the tiniest sink I have ever seen, and a kitchen area with a sink, microwave, and refridgerator. We left our things and went sight seeing. There were a number of people hanging around on the opposite corner, but nothing we haven't seen in our hometown (Philadelphia, PA). We came back after sight seeing and called it a night. The next morning, we ate breakfast (good selection including eggs, muffins, bagels, and waffles). Check out was easy and we took the streetcar to the Cruise port. Everything was great until later that night when I started itching on my right forearm. I pull up my sleeves and my arm was so red and I couldn't believe it! There were bite marks all over the place. It put a realy damper on the first two days of the cruise because I was itching a lot and my mom and I had to go to the infirmary to get antibiotics, anti-itch cream, and alcohol pads to clean out the area. Eventually, the bites went down and I enjoyed my trip. All in all, if it wasn't for the bed bugs, this hotel would've gotten three stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: trippick-17
Reviews.Content: I was there during the NCAA final four. The hotel was decent...3 stars. The room was clean and spacious, but the shower didn't work that well. They kept saying they would send someone up, but they never did. Breakfast was good...with lots of choices from cereal, yogurt to eggs, french toast. We were close to the superdome (easy walk about 6 blocks). We were about a 10 minute walk to the French quarter. The staff was friendly and willing to help, offer directions despite being quite busy. The only negative was there a good bit of homeless people hanging out within a block, but I think that's pretty common for Canal St. There was a significant police presence which was nice. Taxi cab drivers were a little shady- careful with that. All in all a very good experience- the people in New Orleans are very nice and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: fhowell2
Reviews.Content: We got off a cruise ship and came to the hotel at 8:30am, not expecting to check in, but to store our luggage and sight-see for a while. The lady clerk told us we could not check in until 2pm. Ok, we stored our luggage and decided to hang out in the lobby because the weather was bad(rainy/cold/windy). Nice lobby, big tv, and sofa. At 2 pm I went to check in and the same clerk told me we couldn't check in until 4pm. No rooms were ready. I mentioned that I had watched numerous people checking out all morning long and asked to speak to the manager. The manager was unavailable 'til 3:30pm. I insisted on checking into a room and another clerk helped us and other people who were in the same situation. We finally got a room. Not a good start. Our room was small,well furnished, clean. The bathroom was clean, no problems. We went to eat an early dinner. There is a streetcar stop almost in front on Canal St. and a bus stop right across the sidestreet. Very convenient. That evening I used the computers in the business for internet. It was high-speed, no cost. The next morning was Sunday and the free breakfast was one of the best I have had in a long time. Scrambled eggs, Italian suasage, biscuits and gravy, potatoes(not hash browns), waffles, juice, coffee, cereal, fresh fruit, etc. Great! We went sightseeing and returned tothe hotel about 4:30pm and our room had not been serviced. Grrrr! My wife went to the front desk and complained. The maid was off duty so we were moved to a 2-room suite, sweet. We still had to move ourselves. No more problems. The next morning I had a normal free breakfast. Biscuits and gravy, potatoes(not hash browns), waffles, juice, coffee, cereal, fresh fruit, etc. Very good. Check out was no problem. It was a different desk staff we had to deal with. This is a nice, clean hotel in a good location, but we will not stay there again because of the staff problems.

Reviews.Title: “There's room for improvement ...”
Reviews.Author: annie_oHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: There are pros and cons to this Clarion Inn. First, the good ... it's within walking distance of both the French Quarter and Bouron St. as well as the Superdome, so a good location as far as proximity goes. We were happy with the room set up ... basically a suite with a seperate bedroom and living area. The bed was comfortable. The living area had a kichenette, which was convenient, and the entire suite seemed clean from what I could tell. We noticed no bugs at all, which have been mentioned in other reviews, so perhaps that problem has been remedied. A complimentary breakfast comes with the room and it's pretty tasty with a good variety of both hot and cold items. Before I mention the cons, I want to say we were at this hotel on a very busy weekend. It was not only spring break, but there was a basketball tournament in town so lots of people and I'm sure the hotel was booked to capacity. However we were dissapointed with a few things. We arrived on a Fri. evening at 7pm and there was no self-parking available and no attendant at the valet parking. We were fortunate to find a luggage cart to get our luggage up to the room, as there is no staff available for that, either. A valet finally showed up and we learned that there are only a couple of dozen on-site parking spots for this 16 story hotel, so the vast majority of guests have to use the valet off-site parking, which they charge $22 a day for. The off site parking is a block from the hotel, so it takes a good 10 min. each time the valet's have to park a car, or get your car for you, and longer if others are also waiting. Our daughter waited 30 min. to get her car when we checked out, as others were checking out at the same time. Our other main complaint was that at breakfast both mornings they ran out of food and there were long lines of guests waiting for the food to arrive (it's catered from somewhere else in New Orleans, so when they run out, it has to be brought in from another location). They were usually out of coffee as well. The food was good, but try to go to breakfast very early to get a full meal without waiting. Another concern was the neighborhood that this hotel is located in. It's on the far north end of the french quarter, more in the business district I think, and there are a number of street people around the hotel at night. At night you see them urinating on the buildings and sidewalks nearby and they may ask for money as you pass by them. We were uncomfortable walking back to the hotel after dark, although we did it both nights we were there. Another problem on the weekend were were there was that there are only 2 elevator for the entire hotel, and as I said, it's a 16 story building, so we usually waited 5 min. each time we used the elevator, and in the mornings when we went to breakfast we waited 10 min. So all in all, if you don't mind waiting (for breakfast, the elevator, and the valet), ... and if you don't mind walking a few blocks through a not-so-good area at night, then I think this hotel would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not Again”
Reviews.Author: Devon S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of a child that needed treatment at a local hospital. We arrived in the evening and were appalled at the laziness of the front desk attendant as well as their "security guard". No greeting, the questions I asked were a bother to them to answer, and with all doors locked with ramps for luggage carrier, and a baby they never even offered to help us with anything just sat there and watched instead of at least saying here can we hold the door open. We finally got our room key after they double booked me and tried making me pay for two rooms, when we got up to the room, imagine our surprise when we walked in and there was someone in the room. Had to go back downstairs and get another room (with a baby again). Then the next morning after paying $14 to park my car, walked out to a drunk with broken beer bottles around my tires. The general manager just said "ma'am we sorry", but never offered to help me clean or move the broken glass so I could leave to make the appointment. Every staff member was sitting there texting on the sofas or kitchenette areas. I didnt expect the Ritz Carlton, but i will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “You have been warned!”
Reviews.Author: BayouChic
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four 4 nights at this hotel during Mardi Gras. First, I gave them the the benefit of the doubt when I arrived with a confirmation in hand and they told me they had given my room away. (This was due to their error keying in the wrong credit card # I found out). No apology. The hotel crammed six of us in a single bed room for the night and promised our larger room the next night. Of course they made our party ck out at 11 of that room the next morning and wait until 3:00 that afternoon to ck into the new room. No help was offered or received for the transfer. The hotel then began to randomly charge our credit and debit cards. (over $1000) When we went to the front desk, they simply denied this was happening until we printed out bank statements to prove it! The debit charges were so much that caused overdrafts and guests without cash. Couldn't get anything from guest services, so the General Manager was asked to help. Totally incompetent, rude, and just did not want to be bothered with his duties. Again, not accepting any fault or an apology. Called housekeeping to ask for additional rollaway, including blankets, pillows, etc. Not going to happen. If they knocked to clean at 7:30-8:00 and you were sleeping, you got skipped until they next day. They did, however, let us have a couple of extra little bottles of shampoo from the cart, since there were six of us. Thanks. The front desk day clerks were the rudest and most uncooperative I have encountered. Mardi Gras is a busy time, but there is still a job to be done and customer service should still be a priority. The General Manager, however, just needs to get into a new line of work. It has taken three more days to clear up the overcharges. Not worth the trouble, even for the location, there are much better choices. We did have beds, a room with a door and a bathroom, but the inconvenience, no maid service, extra bedding, and billing errors that were quite questionable, along with a staff that lacks any sort of professionalism, is just not acceptable. What a nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and good price for walking distance to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: sherri56
Reviews.Content: After having spent one night in a hotel that was booked on-line with Priceline, that turned out to be a nightmare, we were VERY pleased to find this hotel. It was within walking distance to the French Quarter and very fairly priced for being right there in town in New Orleans. It's on the same street as the Ritz-Carllton and other big name hotles and seriously less than half the price. It's walking distance to the river front with sites like the Aquarium of the America's and other family type entertainment. New Orleans is a very old city, and with the hurricanes of past years there are a lot of run down areas in the city, but this is true of all urban settings, But I felt very safe in this location. There is a very nice marble lobby with columns and high ceilings, leather couches and an area with tables and a TV where they serve the continetal breakfast in the mornings, and front desk that is manned 24/7 to keep any unwanted folks out!! Our room was small as is common in older hotels in big cities (but much bigger than european hotel rooms) and did not feel tight or confining. It had been recently updated and the decor was tasteful. The room had a nice secure heavy door, and a small but nice kitchenette that was set aside from the main part of the room with a small fridge, sink, coffee maker, and cabinets with dishes and cutlery. The room over looked the city streets, but was not noisy at all, and there was self parking right across a quiet little side street for just $14 a day, or you could opt for the "garage" parking that was $20 a day, but the self parking across the street was easy and by far much more convienant for us. The bathroom was nice also with white marlbled walls and floors and a jetted tub, that is great for relaxing at night if you've been walking all day around the french quarter and your feet and legs are tired. We were there in June and it was terribley HOT, and the A/C was great in the hotel...both in our room and in the lobby (such a treat to get back to the hotel after walking in the heat for hours). We only paid $90 a night, plus the $14 a day for parking which wasn't bad, considering we were being charged $77 a night for a flea bag (well known chain hotel) in Slidell, La. which was a good 20 minute ride to the city...and we had no working A/C and couldn't even get toilet paper at this "Priceline" special hotel.......plus we got a free breakfast at the Clarion.....but you must get there early. We came down at around 8AM and it was still plentiful, but there was np place to sit.....all in all very pleased for $20 more bucks a night!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than reviews”
Reviews.Author: fetwstephens
Reviews.Content: I had read numerous reviews online and had my doubts about staying in this hotel. However, it was Mardi Gras and all hotels were full so I took my chances. I am glad I did, it was much better than I expected. The room was small but very clean and the hot water got very hot! The room had a coffee pot and kitchen and everything was located within walking distance. The parade came by right out the front door, all we had to do was fix a drink and go outside and watch it. The breakfast was very good and the eggs and grits were the best I have ever had and I am from Georgia and we do grits a lot here. The only disappointment I had with this hotel was the staff was not very friendly and the "service elevators" did not work. The maids should have been using the service elevators with their carts as well as people trying to get their luggage up and down. This hotel has 16 floors and if you are up on the one of the higher floors you do not want to take the steps, so you have a terrible time trying to use the elevators if the maids have their carts in there. I understand it is Mardi Gras week and a very busy time however, if the service elevators were working the people would be able to move around and not spend so much unneccassary time waiting for the only two working slow elevators in the whole place! Then each time we needed something or had to ask the desk, they acted as if we were bothering them. I know Mardi Gras is a hectic time but I thought they should know that and be more prepared. Also, the Indian man that stands around watching you eat your breakfast is kind of creepy. But, alll in all I thought this hotel a very good deal and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Five nights a few weeks before Mardi Gras and it was "just OK", nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Twowilliams
Reviews.Content: There were just so many things that kept annoying me about the place even though the room was quite clean and furnishings were nice. The halls are freshly done with very attractive tile but it makes for a NOISY place especially since all the big heavy doors there SLAM LOUDLY. Every day the room cleaners' standard changed as related to one aspect or the other - no real bother but it screamed inconsistency which seems to be the theme in this not-so-well-managed hotel. Had to get moved from my 15th floor (great view) room the first night as the internet access was flawed there - as verified by the guy at 1-800 number that did a great job of trying to get me online. Internet after that was reliable but slow. Frig froze and destroyed all my drinks and there was no control know anywhere to adjust it. Breakfast is fine if you like lots of sugar carbs and starchy things. The raisin bran was reliable but the only protein available was hard boiled eggs that could not easily be peeled. Came down one morning at 8:55 and lady doing breakfast told me it was too late to refill the hot stuff even though she conceded that the posted time of breakfast was until 9:30. Parking situation is reliable and secure and that was important as I had a very large cargo van and it was just $14 a day. Would have given 3 stars were it not for that. Had problem getting room cleaned and acting manager claimed they had tried to clean it 3 times each of 2 days in question and that I had DND sign on door - neither of which were true. There were other weird interactions as well and the exercise room located in purgatory was not at all inviting nor professionally set up. They just have a few dated machines. Overall the place is pretty clean and the price is right if you don't mind a 6-10 minute walk to the heart of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Tennesseelucy11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite which had three doubles. Great room, great views and walking to attractions was a breeze the hotel staff was great and they served a full breakfast. The meal was delicious. Would stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kyle U
Reviews.Content: I give this Hotel a 3/5 It was a decent stay the rooms were very modern and updated, clean sheets, and friendly staff. However.. when we arrived to our room the closet shelf, along with iron and ironing board had fallen off the hinges literally and laid on the ground next to the kitchen area(turn off). Secondly for paying $140.00/Night + Tax and $14.00 Parking I expected more.. The television was an older model contrary to a flat screen, and it was quite blurry at first before it warmed up. Also one of the in-room phones did not work correctly. All in all this hotel wasn't as bad as every makes it seem, however there are some flaws and the price in my opinion is clearly overpriced. Good breakfast though, if you get up early!

Reviews.Title: “Does a Short-Term Job”
Reviews.Author: TheBDJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night whilst waiting for a flight to get back to England. It did absolutely the job it was intended to do and made me think it would be perfectly adequate for short stays whilst in New Orleans or longer stays if you just need a 'base'. The room was fairly large and had a full kitcken facility which was rather novel. The bathroom was small but useable and the beds were comfortable. The internet access was not bad at all and was free as I would expect it to be. The location of this hotel is not perfect. Whilst you are on Canal St, you are still several blocks from the heart of the French Quarter and this is not an area I would like to see a woman walking alone late at night. Having said that, as long as you are with someone else, preferably with at least one man, then there is nothing to really fear. The area is pretty well lit. I found the hotel to be reasonably priced and felt that all in all it 'did a job'. Would I stay here if I was with my wife? No. Would I stay here again if I was with friend? Yes. I would stress though that there are likely better, cheaper, safer options further into the French Quarter which probably renders this hotel unnecessary unless you can't get into the others.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Nick H
Reviews.Content: I was scared to stay here after reading the bad reviews. I stayed here 1/14/2012 and it is a good hotel. First off if you have never been to New Orleans I can see where you would say it's in a bad nieghborhood. This hotel is only a few blocks from the french quarter and me and my girlfriend walked it late at night with no problems. As for the hotel being small, the rooms are divided into a sitting area and a sleeping area and it is this reason that makes the rooms look small. If the rooms were not divided it would be an average hotel room size (I know I travel alot and stay in a lot of hotels), As for how clean the rooms are, they are very clean and I believe it is the age of the hotel that puts people off. Remember this hotel has been through many changes and been around for a while. Overall a good hotel with an amazing continental breakfast and friendly service...PS there were families staying in this hotel and no bed bugs or roaches like I had read about...WILL STAY HERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “If you plan on getting smashed in the Quarter and don't can't find anywhere else to stay... This is your place”
Reviews.Author: Tpoet
Reviews.Content: I rely on these reviews to make my decisions about where to stay so I thought you would like to hear about my experience. I stay in New Orleans at least once a month on business and have stayed at a lot of hotels around the French Quarter. This place was the worst by far of all my experiences over the last 5 years. First off they offer valet parking, but when I arrived at noon they told me their parking was full and I was on my own to find parking... In the French Quarter... In ann unsecured location. The strange thing is the claim check in is at 4pm and check out is at 11am... How could they be out of parking when guests had checked out an hour before. What this tells me is they simply do not have enough parking to accomidate all their guests and know this. So they did let me check in at 3pm, an hour early after I spent 2 1/2 hours trying to park my car, 4 blocks from the hotel in an area I was sure my car nor it's contents would be there in the morning. I went to the room and took off my shoes to unwind when my socks got soaking wet. First off I would not walk around in the room without socks. The floors just looked like they had not seen a real cleaning other than a vacuum run over them in 20 years. So I went to the front desk an spoke to the gentleman there. He was of no help and acted like he did not understand what I was talking about. So I asked for the supervisor who told me the Hotel was full and they could not move me. After a long amount of time begging the said they could upgrade me to a suite for an increased charge!!! They just told me there were no other rooms, they were completely booked. And the gaul to charg me when the room I was in obviously had an issue. So instead of fighting with them I paid the increase and went to my room. As far as suites go this was not terrible though there were no towels, no toilet paper and the bathroom looked like someone washed their dog in there. The cleaning staff was not up to par with even a Super 8. All in all if you plan on going out and getting bombed and don't care where you pass out then this hotel is for you, but bring your checkbook, I ve stayed at hotels 10 times nicer than this in NOLA for half the price. I for one will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: tequilaboom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided Christmas morning to go watch the Saints play. We called the hotel and the lady at the front desk was very helpful, she answered all our questions that we had about the area. We booked the room, we arrived early and our room was ready. The room was on Canal Street, but it was not as loud at all. We booked the king room and it was large compared to what we thought it would be like. Very clean and no problems with anything.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern feel-- small room, decent location”
Reviews.Author: theatregeek7
Reviews.Content: This was a great decision! It's within walking distance to the French Quarter and for half the price. The room was a bit small, but not cramped. The furniture looks and feels pretty new-- really comfy bed and a new desk chair. The bathroom was clean, with new tiling and a new vanity. They also feature daily breakfast in the AM, free wireless internet throughout hotel, and $5 a day parking. The hotel has a modern feel with lots of art work in the lobby. Check out the elevators-- still have the old style numbers over it in the lobby (doesn't work anymore though). Seriously-- check this one out. You'll enjoy it and won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, nice location, bug bites...not so nice!”
Reviews.Author: J-RIV
Reviews.Content: Hotel located close enough to the French Quarters but far enough away to avoid Bourbon's nightly "freaks". Pros: helpful hotel staff, decent rate, wide variety of breakfast foods, secured parking Cons: very small rooms, extremely small shower (forget shaving your legs), paper thin walls (couple next door know what we mean), room temperature very cold at night, and last but not least.......BED BUGS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I woke up after our second night with 3 bites on my ankle and two on my leg. Will opt to stay elsewhere next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - do NOT be afraid of previous reviews!”
Reviews.Author: erin542
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for 3 nights so far and have had no problems! No bed bugs, no cockroaches, no blood stains, no broken elevators, nothing! I was terrified on our flight here after reading these previous reviews and I was worked up for no reason. Location to the French Quarter and St Louis Cemetery 1 was just a short walk. Yes the area is alittle sketchy but you just have to be aware of your surroundings. Free hot breakfasts and welcoming staff have made this trip perfect!

Reviews.Title: “bugs”
Reviews.Author: will s
Reviews.Content: I was OK with the smell in the lobby, the street people outside, the shoddy renovations. I was OK with the contempt when I asked the desk who I should call for a food delivery late at night. I was OK when the deliveryman brought a prostiute with him...laughed that off as local flare and declined. HOWEVER I am not ok with the bedbug nightmare I am enduring 24 hrs after staying in this dump. Saw a spot or bug on the sheets and didn't think much of it...until later when the bites started itching, blistering, and oozing puss. Try to find a different place. We stayed at the Staybridge Suites earlier in the week, and it was fine. Great even, and with a much better neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine hotel, but just a little bit far from French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: lyrix428
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in October . The hotel was just fine, and we got a decent rate. The room was very clean and comfortable and included a microwave and small refrigerator which was great. Free wifi was a plus, and it worked very well. They offer free breakfast but I didn't take advantage of that so I can't comment on the quality. The downsides: small shower, the room didn't get quite as cold as I would have preferred (glad I wasn't there in the summer), and it was located just a little bit farther from the French Quarter than I would have preferred. It wasn't a safety thing; I felt comfortable enough walking back to the hotel at night. It was just that I'm old and tired after walking around all day! I do believe, though, that we could have taken the street car at least part of the way to/from the hotel; we just didn't for whatever reason. I'm not sure if I would stay there again. It would just depend on if I could get a room closer to the French Quarter at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Was that a roach!?”
Reviews.Author: gomabster
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel over a 15 times, over the past 8 or 9 years. I have seen the name change from Clarion, to Amerihost, to Lexington O, and back to Clarion. The reason I like the place is that the location is in between the Superdome and Bourbon Street. The free WiFi and breakfast is a plus too. I never had issues with the noise, the people around the side streets, or the staff. But, during my last trip I had to deal with roaches in the bathroom....which was an issue for me. I saw one adult roach in the bathroom in my first room, and thank goodness I was able to move to another room. Then a day later, I saw a roach in the bathroom in that room too, which was five floors higher than the first room. Due to the hotel being at-capacity, I didn't try to move again. But, seems like I need to fine me another "crash pad" for my NOLA stays. I certainly do not need to be bringing back any critters.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: stareyes13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night to experience The New Orleans nightlife. Wow, we had fun! The Queen room was small, but everything was clean. The bed was comfortable with extra pillows & the bathroom was spotless. They even had a flat screen TV. The check in process with Mr. Perez, was great & check out was a breeze. The location is close to the trolley that will take up & down Canal street for a small fee & if you are willing to walk, you are super close to the French Quarter. This was a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap & location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: amandas711
Reviews.Content: Typically when I travel, I try to stay at B&Bs so I can get a better sense of the area, local flavor, etc. (see my review & strong recommendation for the Maison Perrier). This time I was sent to New Orleans for business and my stay was booked for me at the Clarion Suites. It's a perfectly nice hotel, the price at the time was unbelievably cheap; I paid under $70 per night. The gym is adequate and the facilities are well-maintained. Perhaps of most appeal for travelers, though, would be its proximity to the French Quarter & Bourbon Street. New Orleans is a bit spread out and if you stay in the Garden District or elsewhere you're dependent on taxis or on your own rental car. Not so for this location. If you're big on walking and intend to spend much of your time exploring the sites of the French Quarter and its environs, this is more than a suitable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Molly253
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a weekend off for my birthday. Staff was very sweet at the front desk, check in was nice and smooth. There was a slight mix up with the valet parking but other than that my stay was nice. Clean rooms and comfy beds. Also a perfect location for shopping and going out! Everything within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the smell of dead mice & manure, you'll love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: InfrequentTrav56797
Reviews.Content: Helpful travel hint: the Clarion hotel on Canal street in NOLA has a lobby that smells like a mix of dead mice and manure, and the abandoned store next to it has an alcove entrance that is apparently the official outdoor urinal for street people. Our bathroom, Room 508, was disgusting. The shower was filthy and appeared to have mold on the walls. If you are seeking such ambiance, the Clarion is the place to be!If you are seeking such ambiance, the Clarion is the place to be! I paid 125.00 for THIS? I will NEVER stay in one of the Choice hotels again. I'm shredding my Choice Privileges card. La Quinta--or practically anywhere else-- here I come!

Reviews.Title: “Scary”
Reviews.Author: travelers227
Reviews.Content: We scheduled this trip at the last minute and this hotel was available. I had always had positive experiences with Clarion Hotels in the past, so I booked a room in this one. Our plan was to eat in the French Quarter, sleep there that night and head to the coast. We never left the hotel. Parking was two blocks away and we HAD to pay $22 for valet service. There was no way that we were going to walk anywhere in that neighborhood, especially at night. I asked other people in the lobby, if they planned to walk anywhere that night. One of them stated, "No, it was scary enough in the daytime."

Reviews.Title: “Decent location - right price!”
Reviews.Author: Erika T
Reviews.Content: This is an interesting hotel in a pretty decent location (4 blocks from the French Quarter, but kind of a skethcy walk if you are alone at night). The hotel staff are friendly, but not as friendly as other hotels I have stayed with. They seem to do as little as possible to keep customers happy (wothout going out of their way). The rooms has fridges and microwaves and the a/c works well (a plus in new Orleans) but the rugs are worn and the bathrooms are very dated (and the amenities could use an upgrade). The bed was bvery comfortable and there was a free breakfast, also a plus. The lobby is very cool with high ceilings and old structual components - maybe a hotel bar in the lobby would attract more people. Free internet was also a plus! Overall, for the price paid, I thought this hotel was well-located and everything the website promised it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for a reason.”
Reviews.Author: Yelbid
Reviews.Content: Small but clean room with full size bed (we requested Queen or King) . No hot water after 9am during our stay. Our sink was round ten inch pot almost too small to shave in without splashing everywhere. Gym hot and airless and half the equipment was out of order. Not well equipped anyway. No tea in the room and staff was unable to locate any but never got back to tell us that. Coffee machine and microwave in the room. Safe was on the floor and free standing so not especially safe. Breakfast is complimentary which is good because I wouldn't have paid for it. We prepaid so no refund when we left early to go to another hotel. But we were happy to move to a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel but well maintained”
Reviews.Author: JJMumbai
Reviews.Content: This is a old hotel but well maintained. Several shopping malls are located within a few miles from the hotel. Hotel also provides free transport between 0800 and 2100 hrs to the Ferry Terminal. There is a free ferry to cross to Downtown Areas like Canal Street, French Quarters, Casino, several restaurants and other attractions located on the other side of the river. Free wifi internet and local calls available in the room. Complementary Breakfast buffet is included in the room charge. Fitness room is also available in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's New Orleans People!!!”
Reviews.Author: TXtraveler450
Reviews.Content: I'm a military retiree and a school teacher from Houston, TX so I know a little bit about traveling and staying in hotels. We arrived a few hours early on Friday and decided to check to see if any rooms were ready. I was greeted by the Manager and he was very accomodating and found us a room (he considered we just drove 6 hours). They have valet parking for $22 but it's two blocks away and not covered so we elected to pay $14 for self parking right on the next corner. Advice: Park and walk because the employees park in those spots! We liked it because we could see our vehicle from our hotel room. They only have 2 elevators and they are very small. We took the stairs to the 4th floor a few times because we never mind using the stairs. We had a very nice room with 2 double beds. Room is not too big but it was functional with two large teenagers. The bathroom was HUGE and very clean. Free Wi-Fi for my IPad and free HBO. There were people coming in and out of the elevator on our floor at all hours of the night and they were loud! We've stayed in several hotels in NO and they were all noisy!!! You learn to just sleep through it. We went down for breakfast on Sat morning looking for our cereal, bagels and fruit. They had grits... tater tots... old fashioned sausage links, cut in 1" pieces... hot eggs.... and biscuits.... along with the cereal and fruit. Haven't had that at the other hotels we stayed at in NO. We walked to the French Quarter on Fri and Sat which was right down the street. "Beware" we walked down on the Clarion side of the street and there are undesirable people just hanging out during the day and night. We walked through some very strong marijuana smoke coming back to the hotel. It's New Orleans, there's people hanging out everywhere. They won't bother you if you don't bother them. Since we had teenagers we just walked on the OTHER side of Canal. I usually don't provide reviews but I felt compelled to write up this place. We have plans to stay at this location everytime we come to New Orleans due to it's in walking distance to the French Quarter and Superdome. Making my next reservation for the end of June.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, Great view, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Limomike
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the hot breakfast selection and the room was great.. I was very happy.. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “F*IN' SUCKED”
Reviews.Author: BTP03
Reviews.Content: "Don't Do It" ...The location was cool, in that it was close to Bourbon St., but it was also right at the corner of a bus stop. A bus stop....nothing but crackheads and drugies at your door step. "It's Weak"....ALSO HOTEL SECURITY IS LOOKIN FOR ANY REASON TO GET YOU IN TROUBLE.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: chasityburks
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find. During check in gave my name to front desk clerk he started to pull of my information but stop to talk on the phone with a customer and started looking up information for the that customer while im standing in front of him it took a least 10 min to check in. Valet guys were so nice ( even tho they had to run a least two blocks to park your car). Breakfast was ok room was nice had a great view on the city. The hotel was near everything so you don't need your car you can walk. Even though I think its over prices it's still a ok hotel if you want to be close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: egersten
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was good... and the proximity to sights and streetcar was good, but not much else was. The staff was not helpful. The hotel was so noisy at night (you could carry on a conversation through the walls... which wasn't fun staying next to a bunch of drunk sorority brats). We were woken up several times nighly. Our room was very small and clean when we arrived, but was housekeeping was strange after that. We started the week with 3 of each towel (Bath, hand, and face) by the end of the week we were down to 1 of most of them... even though we had put them back on the rack to show we would use again. The bathroom did not have a fan, so if you took a hot shower the room got very humid very fast. The neighborhood is a little rough. There are lots of people loitering arround in front of the nearby closed-up movie theater or tatoo parlor. I wish we had spent a little more and stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “you cant polish a turd”
Reviews.Author: pdxgirllovestravel
Reviews.Content: okay that headline is pretty tacky but oh so true! lol upon arrival i was greeted outside by a couple who were waiting for the police as they said there wallet was stolen right out of their room...i didnt bring anything valuable that i would leave in the room, as i had heard there is a problem with pick pocketers on bourbon..our room was just okay, the hotel itself was pretty run down...the staff were semi friendly...that said we wouldnt stay there again, the area is really run down & the people loitering outside were pretty scary...i say spend a little bit extra to get a better New Orleans experience, good luck travelers :o)

Reviews.Title: “Great New Orleans Location and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ladeelawyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a few blocks from Bourbon Street and the French Quarter. The staff were friendly. Valet parking was available. The concierge/bellman was knowledgeable and helpful. The rooms were very nicely furnished, more like a higher priced hotel with very nice bedding and decor. There was a coffee pot with local coffee in the room. Full breakfast consisted of nice pastries (including the Mardi Gras king cake appropriate for the season), eggs, sausage, hash browns, biscuits, gravy, grits, coffee, tea, juices, assorted cereals, boiled eggs. Seating was limited but adequate. It tood a while to get things replenished. We would easily stay at this hotel again when in New Orleans planning to go into the quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: howza1126
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be friendly and accomodating. Not the best location as the people out on the sidewalks within a block of the hotel were just, plain unfriendly! However, get past that and the folks around New Orleans really try to make you feel welcome, at least during Mardi Gras. Overall, I'd say this is a good hotel for the money. The biggest drawback to the room was the tiny bathroom. The sink was hardly large enough to wash your hands in! However, we didn't go there to spend much time in our room. Valet service was prompt and friendly as well. hey also provided a safe, refrig., coffee maker and a microwave in the room.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: ashleeb89
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel and checked in, while checking in I noticed the hotel clerk swiping my card twice and he didn't say anything. I got up to our room and checked my online banking and the hotel charged me $160 twice. I called the front desk and she stated she was going to let her manager know. The shower did not have hot water and the shower didn't even work. When leaving the next day, I talked to the manager about his hotel double charging me and he said well your going to need to call the number and right when he went to finish, I said don't tell me that I need to call the number on the back of my card to get a hold of my bank, because I work for the bank and I told him he needs to fax a copy with his letter head showing he double charged me and for my bank to release the funds. After I told him that and he asked for my fax number, he didn't apologize and he didn't even look at me anymore. This hotel is HORRIBLE and I love New Orleans but they need better Management at this hotel and all there problems need to be fixed....

Reviews.Title: “Worse Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: cjpitsch
Reviews.Content: Place of over priced for the accommodations. No cancellation policy. Would not recommend it to anyone. Smoke free room was obviously scented to mask smoking room (at one time). Bathroom tub had mold growing everywhere. For a suite it was the smallest one we have ever experienced. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Sugar Bowl Location”
Reviews.Author: 4realguy
Reviews.Content: I was here with my souse for Sugar Bowl 2011. I read reviews before coming to New Orleans and can understand some of the concerns. For this event, things were good at this hotel. I am not sure when there isn't any events. It felt very safe because police were on every corner of most blocks. They said that their self parking ($14) was full. We used the valet parking ($22) which worked, but a guest stated that his vehicle was ticketed from valet parking his car in an authorized space. He said that management was suppose to clear it up but I am not sure. Bourbon St/French Quarter is just short 5 to 10 minute walk a few blocks away. We also walked to and from the Superdome in no time at all. The hotel is old, but it is clean and our room was pretty clean. We did find trash in the ice bucket. We were curious to why our toilet paper was wet and later found out that there was a leak in the ceiling. Maintenance came and then told me they solved the problem but what they did do did not work. They sent up two extra rolls of tissue. If I had a longer stay I would have wanted another room. The breakfast at the hotel is one of the best in the business. Only Drury Inn breakfast compred to it. Basically a full breakfast with hot food(eggs, sausage, grits, cold food,, fruit, cereal, waffles, all beverages.ect... The kitchen in the rooms have stove top, microwave, and mini Fridge. I would recommend the hotel to someone who is not lookinjg for perfection. It is nice especially if you get a good deal for the area. The location is between french quarter and Superdome. It is more quiet than if you stayed in French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Low class, Dirty, Staff..very unprofessional!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jetset_Denise
Reviews.Content: Rooms were dirty Staff would offer to spray Febreze when guests complained about the smell .. ( I was thinking.. ARE U SERIOUS? Apparently they weren't kidding! O-kay! ) Given keys to a room that was occupied..apparently the guest had not checked out (Shouldn't they know if a room is empty, guess they don't clean the rooms either! ) Then... given keys to a room in which the keys were unable to open the door ( Thinking .. IS THIS REALLY HAPPENING RIGHT NOW..) Then go downstairs to find a staff at the front desk, who we will call "M". She proceeded to get an attitude with us, like it's our fault we walked into someone else's room and it's our fault that we were given keys to another room and the keycards didn't work because I really enjoyed squeezing my luggage into their tiny elevator twice! Unprofessional, low class! Needless to say after 2 hours we booked another hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Stay Again.”
Reviews.Author: John46142
Reviews.Content: The hotel is run by foreigners. The manager stood around and watched his patrons eat up his profits. The elevators were slow and even broke on the day we arrived. The first morningâ€™s breakfast was 5 stars but each day after that only thing hot were the waffles and coffee. There were no eggs our second and third morning. Even the cheaper Quality Inns have a better breakfast than this Clarion. The manager should stay at the Quality Inn in Beaumont TX and take a lesson in what to serve for breakfast. We had stayed at a Drury Inn in San Antonio which has a 5 star breakfast every day. I was expecting the same at this Clarion. I also expected the hall floors to be carpeted and not tiled in a Clarion. Our room had been updated but the work in the bathroom should not past Choice Hotels inspections to give this hotel the Clarion name. This hotel is closer to being a Quality Inn. Because we were there on a weekend with a football game, we had to pay a premium rate plus the total cost of the three nights was charged to my charge card three weeks before we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel I have ever stayed at...rude and ignorant staff- don't do it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheTruth30_10
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. I am a very well traveled individual and I have to say the staff were non-compliant, un-helpful and just plain rude. The elevators did not work the entire time we were there...our room was on the 9th floor. There was nobody to help us at anytime. The housekeepers were yelling every morning waking us up. The general manager was very rude and did not care to help us in any way. They overcharged me and would not reimburse me for any of it. I went through corporate and they did not do anything about it! Do not stay there...the worst and most unprofessional experience I have ever had with a hotel. Trust me on this!!

Reviews.Title: “If you can sleep through a bomb then save your money and stay here!”
Reviews.Author: fafafouy
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at another hotel when in NOLA but decided to give this one a try because the price was right (our normal spot was pricey because it was Halloween and Voodoo weekend). After reading the reviews we figured it seemed decent enough for crashing at while we attended Voodoo fest. The rooms are decent and seem to be kept clean by staff although they are SMALL...our queen room had a shower that looked like it came out of a camper. Whoever did the "renovation" on the room we were in must have been hired from underneath a bridge...the wallpaper, molding, caulking, cabinets were laughable at best...but really not an issue for us as we just wanted a place to catch ZZZs. I had read about the slow elevators and I can attest to that as we were on the 10th floor and actually had to walk the stairs one morning for breakfast because one of the only two elevators was out of commission. I'm rambling...so the reason I rated this place so poorly and would NEVER go here again is the acoustics. The hallway outside of the rooms are tiled. This combined with heavy steel doors that close automatically makes for a very NOISY experience. In a city like New Orleans where people come and go at all hours of the day and night, you don't want common areas that amplify sound. We could literally hear every conversation of people waiting for the elevator and the elevator was around the corner and 50 feet away! We also were lucky enough to be on the floor where the cleaning staff and maintenance guys had their daily watercooler conversation! Combine this with the fact that the hotel is on the "fringes" so there is constant Police siren activity outside all hours of the night and it is nearly impossible to sleep for more than an hour straight...unless you are the type of person who can sleep through a bomb. So to sum up: Pros: Cheap Free Breakfast Fairly Clean Rooms Staff was pleasant Wifi (pretty slow in our room) Cons: NOISY Slow, barely functioning elevators You may have to utilize your self defense skills if you cross the wrong person outside NOISY Did I mention....NOISY?

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: KenandTeri
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Clarion prior to embarking on a cruise from the Port of New Orleans. Arrived in NOLA too early to check in, but hotel staff were great - offered to secure our luggage and allowed us to park in their lot while we waiting to check in. Location was only disappointment - walkable to Bourbon Street and the French Quarter, but had to walk through a couple of blocks that were less than desireable to get there. Would not walk alone. We requested a queen non smoking bed. Room was very small - had everything we needed, but no room to spare at all! Bathroom was a good size - no tub, but stand up shower was fine for us. Breakfast was OK - basic waffles, pastries, cereal and biscuits and so-called gravy. Overall this was a good hotel for the money. We'll probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “suites are spacious and clean but note location”
Reviews.Author: cew75
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a step above a normal choice hotel. suites are extremely clean and spacious. location on canal street is less than desirable.

Reviews.Title: “Just the facts ma'am”
Reviews.Author: Pink921
Reviews.Content: This is the experience my husband & I had on a Saturday night: Pros: Nice room, nice lobby, large breakfast buffet. Staff was nice and helpful. Cons: Had to wait 50 minutes for car to be brought to us by valet. We heard doors sham shut 5 times after midnight. A couple of places walking back to hotel had some riff raff hanging around (but they didnâ€™t bother us). Bottom line, next time we will stay at a hotel that is below Rampart Street.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed during Jazzfest and paid for it!”
Reviews.Author: Tellingitlikeiseeit
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights during Jazzfest 2010. Paid $200 per night for a standard room only a few days in advance of arrival, which was the cheapest place I could find within reasonable distance of the French Quarter. At any other time of year I would expect to pay about $100 per night for what I got. Jazzfest was great though! Pros - The room was clean and well furnished, with excellent free wifi. - Complementary breakfast which included decent range of food (bacon, eggs, cereal, pastries and fruit). This positive was somewhat reduced by having to eat from tacky styrofome plates, bowls and cups. - Access to business centre with printer, etc. - Staff were polite and fairly efficient. - Elevators were ssssssllllllllloooooooooowwwwwwww - Decent location on Canal Street within walking distance to the French Quarter and River. If you find the distance too far to walk you can take street cars or buses which stop along the street. Cons - Surrounding area can feel a bit unsafe as the location is further north along Canal Street than most other hotels, and there are fewer tourists to blend in with. I passed by large groups of 'homeboys' on my way out and way back to the hotel every day and usually felt unsafe. - Shower in my room had a slippery floor that was dangerous. - The conceirge peddles timeshare presentations. I was foolish enough to accept and was given the wrong time to arrive and misled about how long I would need to stay. In the end I received 2 free tours valued at $100, but I think I would have preferred to spend the money and have more time to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Bourbon Street!”
Reviews.Author: K2anointed
Reviews.Content: Was here for Memorial Weekend and LOVED it! I had no idea when I booked if it was a good location or not, but it looked like it was on a busy main street so I went for it. I had a one-bedroom suite, my friend had a regular room. We were both happy. It was a first trip to New Orleans for both of us. She took the Street Car everywhere, but I walked. Bourbon Street was only a few blocks away. No need for the Street Car to get there. There is also a CVS and WalGreens within walking distance for necessities. The Clarion is located away from the main traffic but not too far down from everything. You might want to be alert, however, when walking back to your room, as a few places like the chinese carryout draw riff raff that hang out in front of it. One guy did start following my friend for a block. I told him we were going to call a cop and he finally left us alone. Other than that, we were very satisfied. The suite was small but comfy and had two televisions, a microwave and frig. The television in the bedroom did not get as many channels as the living room, for some reason. Not a great view out the windows, just a parking structure. The bed was super comfortable. I did hear a train whistle twice, but not enough to keep me awake. The desk staff was friendly and helpful. There are two computers in the business center and the breakfast had a waffle iron, fruit salad, cereal, hot biscuits and an assortment of breads, bagels, and muffins. I would definitely stay there again for the price!

Reviews.Title: “love the city...the hotel, not so much”
Reviews.Author: the50sgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Canal Street. Convenient, but you do need to hop on the trolly that stops outside and go down a few blocks to get to Bourbon Street. It's a good location to get away from the noise and hustle that is on Bourbon if that is what you are looking for. There are quite a lot of people that seem to congregate on the side of the street that the hotel is on so if you don't want to be hassled, cross the street or hop on the trolly. The hotel does not have a restaurant but you are able to order food from a restaurant called Duffy's down the street and they will deliver it to you. The food from there is not bad and the portions are good sized. If you opt to try getting a drink or snack out of the vending machines, just plan on losing your money now. For the entire stay of 5 days during Jazz Fest, I don't think they were refilled once. It's easier to just stop at the CVS or Walgreens down the street, stock up on stuff, and keep it in the kitchenette in the room. The rooms were actually pretty big. The beds were very comfortable & the a/c can get pretty cold which is a bit of a relief when it's 80% humidity down there. Be careful in the shower...there are no mats on the shower floor and it is quite possibly the most slippery tub in the world. I should have been wearing swim shoes in there! At least then I wouldn't have fallen over and bruised my hip pretty badly. Funny at the time but the pain of the next 4 days was not. There are odd stains on the walls, floors, etc. so if this stuff makes you queasy, this will not be the place for you. Overall for the price you pay, it's an ok place to stay. I think next time I might just pony up the extra dough and stay in the Quarter though! Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nickyhuk
Reviews.Content: Came to stay at Hotel travelled from England.... The hotel was amazing....The Room was spotlessly clean and tidy, Had a view of the street below, and the view of a night was Lovely. I had a double room on the 9th floor. Breakfast was hot and we could take it up to our room.... There was a guy that would see us in to the hotel which is great for safety. Two things.... 1. to the right of the hotel is a bus stop and a run down building, i was very worried when i got there as to my safety... But i shouldnt have been as i was fine. 2. we left a half an hour gap for our car to be brought to us as we had a appointment to keep. The car took 25 mins to be brought to us so we was late... Make sure you leave lots of time for car to be brought to you. Other than these i can not fault the hotel at all and i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Money well spent”
Reviews.Author: JennyCalhoun
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the eleventh floor in a king-sized bed room. The room overlooked Canal St. and had an OK view. We paid 90 bucks a night, which included taxes. The other reviews were correct in that there was a sketchy corner we had to pass on the way to the French Quarter, the walls were thin and the key cards didn't work consistently. However, the furnishings were nice, the bed very comfortable and it was convenient to have internet access in the room. We enjoyed our stay so much, we extended our stay by a night and the management was easily able to accommodate our request. The parking is first-come, first-serve so have a back-up plan. We were able to find a nearby parking garage for 6.75 a day. The garage was not easily accessible during the night but we didn't need the car anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Was It Really an Up-Grade ?”
Reviews.Author: JK_Hero
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Clarion because of the rooms it offered -- 5 guys each wanting a bed. We reserved a room with 3 double beds and a room with 2 queen beds. When we arrived, we were told that all of those rooms were already occupied, but that we'd be given up-grades. The up-grades both turned out to be rooms with 1 queen bed and 1 fold-out couch. They were considered up-grades because they were suites -- that means a small kitchen area and a really small bathroom. Also, the cards programed as room keys didn't work -- even after three repeat efforts by the front desk. Each time we wanted into our rooms, we had to have the front desk send a maintenance guy with us. I strongly suggest that you view reservations at this hotel with sketicism.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel for groups”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELAGENTHouston
Reviews.Content: We had group of students coming to New Orleans and couldnt be happier with this hotel. Vickie - group sales manager in Clarion is a super lady... Very helpfull! Hotel location is super, our group was able to have walking tours of Downtown New Orleans and thats a HUGE PLUS. Breakfast was filling, rooms are big,clean, nice and updated, beds very comfy :) Thank you Clarion :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location, good rooms - good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Arrege
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in town for a business conference from Feb 1 to Feb 3 - we stayed at this Hotel for 4 nights. Hotel Itself: We had a room on one of the upper floors w/ one Queen Bed. The room was an OK size - adequate space for suitcases, closet space was good. It even had a small kitchen counter top and sink - allowing us to make our own sandwiches etc. There is also some cabinet space above the kitchen counter area to store any non-perishable foods. The TV was an Older - CRT - type unit that had poor sound quality - and limited channels as well. The bathroom was clean and hot water worked great. The Shower had great water pressure and excellent hot water. This was NOT a full bath/shower...just a standing shower - like in a locker room. The problem here was that the drain was not properly designed. Instead of making the drain lower than the rest of the floor, it was higher - so all the water does NOT go down...instead it goes to the edges of the shower. It did not affect us too much though. Good heating (especially since it was petty cold that weekend in town), quite street - even though we faced Canal Street. During the day, there were a lot of ambulances going up and down Canal - but this seemed to quiet down more at night. Our main issue was that on Sat nite, guests down the hall kept going in and out of their rooms - slamming the doors shut. This was hard to sleep thru. It was much quieter on Sun/Mon/Tue nites. Location: The location was great. Only about 10 mins walk to the French Quarter and about 15-20 mins to the Waterfront/Casino area. We drove here, so we could get out of the main drag and see other parts of the city and had better eating choices. Or you could jump on a street car if you prefer ( we did). Parking: They have a lot down the street - about 30 yards from the front door - where you can park your car outside - in a gated facility - for an extra fee. Front Desk; Very helpful and polite people. If they did not know the answer to a question, they would look it up on line, print stuff out and hand us maps etc. Wifi connection- Decent in the rooms. Neighborhood - It's fine during the day, but at night, they have some 'strange' characters loitering around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: dog4life360
Reviews.Content: Locations: Excellent (one corner a little shady, but its New Orleans!). Rooms: clean, small and a little used. View: DO NOT STAY IN A ROOM THAT ENDS IN -11(EG. 211, 311, 411). You will have 2 windows with views of cement walls. Breakfast: Skimpy...Cold cereal, coffee, donuts, make-ur-own waffles. Value: Good (paid about $55/nt) Staff: Okay I would stay here again. There is no need for a rental car. There is a public bus that takes you from the airport to the hotel for $2 and streetcars that go everywhere. Bourbon St is only 4-5 blocks walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: luluisme
Reviews.Content: Really pleased with this hotel. The room had 3 beds and was very comfortable for the 3 of us. Very clean, well maintained. Fast elevators, too! Check in was fast and easy, as was check out. The parking is next door and they do lock it up at night, so we didn't have to worry about break ins. The walk to the French Quarter isn't bad. I would take a cab at night if I was in a party of less than 3, though, just to be cautious. Stay on Canal St. during the evening around the hotel and you should be ok. No one bothered us, a group of 3 women, except for one drunk who verbally harassed us, but that was really further up the road going towards the Quarter. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - please support them with your business”
Reviews.Author: Canmerican
Reviews.Content: This property used to be the dormitories for Tulane Medica School/University and were damaged during Katina. Clarion has spent and is spending a lot of money to renovate and upgrade this property. There are some rough edges, mostly painting still in progress, but overall, they;ve done a great job with what they have. Rooms are nice, modern, clean. Housekeeping is good. Desk staff is friendly and helpful. Excellent business center. The fitness center has over 10k of brand-new equipment and purified water. I have stayed in hotels before and after Katrina and I have never seen such a well equipped fitness center. Seriously. My onley beef is qith the continental breakfast. I;ve had better and certainly more complete. This is my only complaint. Hey, I like to eat when I get up! About 8 blocks from Bourbon St on the CBD side of Canal St. Not a bad walk. If you are feeling insecure about walking to the Quarter but can't afford a cab, walk down the neutral zone to Bourbon St. Watch for streetcars. Not difficult. Check out Cemetery No.1, which is only 2 blocks to the east. Do it in daylight. Don;t let the projects you walk by faze you. Folks are more friendly than you think. NOLA needs tourist dollars and the locals know this. Be nice. Smile and thank folks for their hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: usxpat
Reviews.Content: Good location, very friendly and helpful staff, good price. Clean and welcoming. Breakfast wasn't up to much; security was excellent. Parking Â£14 per day, right next door to the hotel, and very secure, but we picked up a coupon at the tourist information office, and got free parking. Excellent business center.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: peachcrek
