Reviews.Content: although this Hotell is on other end of Canal street, we woul stay there again we did not mind the walk from Bourbon it was about 6 blocks we stayed one night after our cruise, we spent most of the day out sight seeing but we were lucky enough to have the hotel take our luggage and store for us all day as we did not check i till 6:30 that same night as the rooms were not available to us at 10:00 am when we arrived off the ship, we stopped at a Resturant on way back one block or so from the hotel on other side of street called DUFFYS a great little hidden gem on Canal, great prices and menu and portions our room was clean and comfortable and we had a frig and micro wave oven, it was small but we just needed a good nights sleep before our trip home

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: byvette
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Clarion during the Essence Music Festival. The room was very large. The beds were very comfortable. They had a full hot buffet on Sat. and Sun. Grits, eggs, bacon, sausage, hot biscuits,waffles,home fries, and plenty of pastries. etc. Free of course. The only qripe I had was that they charge your credit card the whole amount of the stay on the day before you arrive. I was not aware that they did that. Usually other hotels only use your credit card to quarantee your room and you have the option of using it or paying cash when you arrive. It did cause me a problem since I used my debit card and was going to pay cash when I arrived. But the front desk was very nice and talked to my bank to have them release the hold from my account. So I was relieved that I wouldnt be charged a insuf fcient fee with my bank. She really when out of her way to help me out . I recomend this hotel very highly. Also they had a very nice excercise room. Which I used every day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: tx2ga
Reviews.Content: I am always leery of booking rooms online and was concerned with other reviews but I took the plunge and I am so glad that I did. I chose the option for a 3 bed room, which I've never seen before and the room was very spacious and clean. Upon arrival, I was very pleased with the warm reception of the front desk agent and other staff members. Once I arrived on my floor, there were several large boxes of appliances in the hallway (the hotel is still being renovated) and I feared noise but to my surprise, there was absolutely none! The shower had great pressure, the water stayed nice and hot and the mini kitchen area was an added bonus. I was leery of the $14 charge for parking in an uncovered area that had to be manually opened after 8pm but when I arrived around midnight, there was a uniformed guard there to let me into the gate and escort me to the hotel entrance. Overall, this was a great value and I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “worth the price”
Reviews.Author: mightyt
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here for the Jazz Fest. The rooms were great. Mini fridge and microwave were good for the leftovers we brought home every night. Staff was always nice. The free breakfast on the weekend was much better than any motel ive ever stayed in. They didnt have the variety during the week, but still better than most. The few blocks leading to the motel were dicey. But I never felt unsafe. The streetcar comes to the door! If you goto to the convenient store on Royal Street one block east of Canal, you can get an all day pass for the city transportation for 5 bucks! All buses and streetcars included. This is the best way to see the Crescent City. This motel is worth the price! ask for a corner room, the view is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay during jazz fest!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CALIFORNIADUDES
Reviews.Content: I cannot see how anyone can find anything wrong with this hotel. We booked 4 rooms during jazz fest. I really expected to have some difficulties due to the fact that we had booked these reservations almost a year ago when the property was called the Lexington Suites. Only one room did not show up on the reservation but the lovely young lady at the front desk took care of the problem immediately and of course honored the rate that was given to us by our travel agent. Special thanks to Karen and Fernando at the front desk who were very personable, professional and efficient, not to mention extremely helpful with tips and recommendations. The rooms we received were very large and the beds were great!!! The microwave and refrigerator were a big plus and were used quite often during our stay. The cleaning staff always left the room spotless and were not intrusive whatsoever. The breakfast was a nice surprise with a great selection and again everything was constantly being replenished so there was no worry of things running out. I would have been nice to extend the breakfast hour one more hour to give the late risers time to catch a bite. The location was good, only a couple of blocks from the french quarter. Though there is one block with some dicey looking characters in front of what looks like a drug den. This part of the street can be avoided by simply crossing the street and going down the center section of Canal Street along the Cable car line. After midnight these establishments were closed and there were no seedy characters hanging about. Overall I would have to say that my experience at this hotel was wonderful and I in my opinion was an extremely good value.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: brandynana
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much because it was only rated 2 1/2 or 3 stars, but I was pleasantly surprised. Hotel was clean, staff was nice and very helpful. Nice room. Reasonably priced. Only five blocks from Bourbon Street. Secured parking available at extra charge on adjacent block. Security on duty and very attentive. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great value-decent location”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: they were still working on the remodeling while i was here, they were actually painting baseboards in the hall on my floor, so at least it shows they are committed to improvement. I gather that choice hotels just recently aquired the property. rooms were clean and nicely appointed - but beware roome with the #10 - very small, only enough room for one person in my opinion. breakfast was great - waffles, good assortment of toast, bagels, muffins. pluse cereal, fruit and oatmeal. seems to be pretty standard at most of the choice brands wireless internet was very weak in my room, but betterin the lobby. rooms ending in #10 like mine are off in a corner so that may have had something to do with it. lcoation - a little sketchy. out my window i could see public housing a block across canal st. Not much right around the hotel. some shady types hanging out in the blocks right around, but i was never bothered or even panhandled. walk 2 blocks south on canal st and it is tourist central - a totally different vibe. Fast food and couple of drug stores there. close enough to french quarter to walk unless you are infirm. plus streetcar boards right in front of hotel. i got a rate of 53$ per night for two nights (thur-fri) in march so it was an exceptional deal for that price, but it may have been b/c they were renovating.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ZAZULibertyUtah
Reviews.Content: The hotel we pre-paid and booked was the Holiday Inn, west bank, gretna , New Orleans. The name was changed to Clarion during the time we spent there. We stayed a total of five days at the peak of Mardi Gras. The hotel offered a shuttle to the French Quarter ferry that was very easy to use. The staff at the hotel were excellent. The morning breakfast was a lot better than most of the Holiday Inns we have stayed at. Would we stay again. Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: tjkarnehm
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed here during Mardi Gra 2009 and we loved it! The room was a lot larger than we expected. The hotel is older but the room was very clean and had an upgraded bathroom & kitchenette. The price was very reasonable and the breakfast that was included was wonderful, besides the normal continental breakfast they also had eggs, sausage, hash browns, waffles, just about anything you would want for breakfast. This hotel is only a couple of blocks from the French Quarter but far enough away that you didn't hear any noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Dand978
Reviews.Content: This hotel was adequate for what I was looking for. The price was right and there was ample space for 4 people. The full breakfast included in the price was satisfactory. Outside of the breakfast, this is a pretty no-frills establishment- no pool or room service, but that was fine with me. The location is a little shady, but the French Quarter is just a block or 2 away.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: dsh4dst
Reviews.Content: Check in is @ 3:00 but we were not able to get into our room until several hours later. When we arrived, the staff was not ready. The front desk manager and the owner lost all respect from us. The front desk manager even made a comment that was totally out of line. He said, "We get what we pay for". The owner sat in the lobby for the majority of the time and refused to admit that he was the owner but he would contact someone to assist us. The staff were still bringing in pillows, irons and ironing boards. They were still setting up rooms. We even found a bucket of paint in the hallway. We reserved a 3 room suite but ended up getting a suite with 3 full size beds. Honestly, it wasn't even a suite. It was a regular double bed room and a third bed was added to accomodate all of us. The hot and cold were mixed up on the shower so we were burned several times. There is no room service, bar or swimming pool on site. The hotel parking lot across the street. It was $14 a day but we weren't able to park there because it was at capacity. The lot is small so we ended up parking in a garage located behind the hotel for half the price. I would not recommend this place to anyone unless they are looking for a place just to lay their head.

Reviews.Title: “I will never patronize this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa W
Reviews.Content: First of all the hotel is in a seedy part of town, second of all I was not given the price quoted to me on priceline. I guess the hotel manager saw fit to increase the nightly rate due to the Essence Festival that was in town and knowingly I could not choose another hotel to stay at. He proceeded to persuade me and tell me the price quoted was priceline's fault, which was not the case because I use priceline for all my vacation needs and they have yet to fail me.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: AdventurousLouisiana
Reviews.Content: The thermostat was at 75 degrees when we checked into the hotel. We lowered it to 60 degrees and an hour later noticed no changes. Maintenance was sent to the room and the gentleman replaced the air filter, checked the thermostat and told us the room should cool off within an hour. We left for about 2 1/2 hours, only to return to the thermostat reading 76 degrees. There were no other rooms available so we were told nothing else could be done. I am not sure how the other rooms felt, but even the lobby was not cool. There was problems with the toilet, but maintenance changed a part and managed to get that working okay.

Reviews.Title: “The stay was ok....”
Reviews.Author: akapearl95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lexington O & Suites April 19-23. The lobby was nice and clean, the front desk service was friendly but I got the impression that it was a very old facility in desperate need of attention. On one day the front desk was undergoing construction so the hammering could be felt throughout the hotel from early morning. On one day one of the two elevators was out of service - mind you neither of the two sounded safe going up or down!! Our room had a loose ring around the shower head which we believe was the entry way for two super large roaches that found their way into the room on two separate nights. (I am terrified of roaches!!). The room was extremely small and the furnishings very dark, including the curtains. If you don't plan to spend much time in the room it's a good place to stay at a reasonable rate. Location wise it's in good walking distance to many shops along Canal Street and the French Quarter. Not sure if I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, O.K. Location, Amenities Lacking”
Reviews.Author: corrineski
Reviews.Content: The Lexington O Hotel and Suites is located on Canal Street a 10 minute walk from Bourbon Street and other attractions. My husband and I (mid 30s, late 20s) went for the French Quarter Festival April 10-14 of this year and can't wait to go back for the festivities. For the low price of $85 a night we were able to get a room close enough, but far away enough from the action. The hotel itself has a nice lobby, free continental breakfast and in room refrigerator. The service was very good at the front desk. They were very accomodating when we showed up hours in advance. The location of the hotel is my only hesitation when writing a review. It is a few blocks off of Bourbon and is right on the street car line. If you choose, however, to walk down Canal at night, be weary. There are projects just 2 blocks away and people loitering in the street for no reason at all hours. Other hotels in the area at the time were triple the price so the value was there, but the location is questionable. Also, just plan on walking around NOLA for your exercise as the gym is about the size of a closet! I would stay there again since we don't spend much time in our room. Happy travels!

HotelInfo.Name: Clarion Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 1300 Canal Street, New Orleans, LA 70112
